intro: Hunteria sundana var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf hunteria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, fragrant, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy appearance. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
